document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements

control.control_purpose: To ensure security mechanisms, service levels and service requirements of network services are identified, implemented and monitored
control.control_objective: Establish and maintain security controls for network services with documented service levels and requirements, monitoring compliance with agreed standards

iso_27001_definition.official_text: Security mechanisms, service levels and service requirements of network services should be identified, implemented and monitored.
key_requirements: Security mechanisms for network services identified
Regular review and reporting of service levels

control_purpose_detail.purpose: Preventive control ensuring network services meet security requirements and agreed service levels
scope: All network services used by organisation
control_purpose_detail.key_outcome: Network services configured and monitored to meet security requirements and service level agreements

prerequisites.description: Before implementing network service security, foundational requirements must be met

required_prerequisites.description: Network security framework defined and implemented
required_prerequisites.rationale: Network service security built upon broader network security framework

required_prerequisites.description: Access control requirements for network services defined
required_prerequisites.rationale: Network service access controlled through access control policy

required_prerequisites.description: Authentication standards for network service access
required_prerequisites.rationale: Network service authentication must meet authentication requirements

required_prerequisites.description: Inventory of all network services used
required_prerequisites.rationale: Must identify all services to apply security controls
required_prerequisites.reference: ISO 27001 A 5.9 - Inventory of information and other associated assets

implementation_requirements.description: Identify and document all network services used by organisation

service_identification: Internal network services (email, file sharing, printing)
External network services from cloud providers
Virtual network services from cloud providers

implementation_requirements.requirement: Define Security Requirements for Network Services
implementation_requirements.description: Identify security mechanisms and requirements for each network service

security_mechanism_identification: Encryption requirements for data in transit and at rest

implementation_requirements.description: Define and document service level agreements for network services

service_level_components: Disaster recovery and business continuity targets

implementation_requirements.description: Document access policies and requirements for network services

access_control: Who is allowed to access network services
What network services they can access
Under what circumstances access is granted
authorization_procedures: Procedures for determining who is allowed access
Removal of access when no longer needed

implementation_requirements.description: Establish logging and monitoring of network service access and activities

logging_requirements: User identity logging for service access
Location and IP address of access logged
Successful and failed access attempts logged
monitoring_activities: Monitoring for service degradation or issues

implementation_requirements.description: Establish regular monitoring and reporting of service level compliance

monitoring_procedures: Monitoring of backup and recovery operations
reporting_requirements: Regular reports to management on service levels
Reporting frequency aligned with contract terms
Reports include performance against SLA metrics
Reports include incidents and service breaches

implementation_requirements.description: Ensure third-party network service providers meet security requirements

service_provider_selection: Service provider reputation and track record evaluated
Service provider insurance and liability considered
contractual_requirements: Security requirements documented in service agreement
Data protection and privacy requirements specified
third_party_attestations: SOC 2 Type II reports from service providers
Regular attestation from third parties required
third_party_monitoring: Regular reviews of service provider SLA compliance
Review of service provider security incident reports
Monitoring of service provider security ratings
Formal quarterly meetings to review service

implementation_requirements.description: Determine and secure different access methods to network services

access_method_security: Each access method assessed for security
Network segmentation for different access types
Logging and monitoring of each access method
Device requirements for each access method

implementation_requirements.description: Deploy specific security features for network services

technical_controls: Encryption of data at rest where appropriate
Web application firewall for web services

implementation_requirements.requirement: Test and Verify Network Service Security
implementation_requirements.description: Conduct testing to verify network service security controls

testing_frequency: Testing as part of internal audits

steps.detail: Create inventory of internal, external and cloud network services
Determine security mechanisms and requirements for each service
Document SLA requirements for availability, performance and support
Document access requirements, authentication and authorization
Deploy logging and monitoring of service access and activities
Finalize SLAs and service agreements with internal and third parties
Obtain and review SOC 2, ISO 27001 and security reports from providers
Deploy encryption, firewalls and other technical controls
Implement regular monitoring and reporting of SLA compliance
Conduct testing to verify all controls are operational

compliance_checklist.description: Steps to comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 8.21

checklist.item: All network services identified and documented
Security requirements defined for each network service
Service level agreements established and documented
Logging and monitoring of service access implemented
Third-party service agreements include security requirements
Third-party attestations (SOC 2, ISO 27001) reviewed and maintained
Different access methods (VPN, wireless, etc.) secured
Network service configuration hardened and secured
Testing of network service security controls completed
Internal audit of network service security conducted

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with network service security

mistakes.mistake: No documented service level agreements or security requirements
mistakes.description: Network services deployed without documented SLAs or security requirements creating uncertainty about what should be protected
root_cause: No formal process for service deployment
mistakes.impact: Inconsistent security across services, audit failures, inability to verify compliance, security incidents
prevention: Establish formal process for identifying and documenting services
Require SLA approval before service goes live
Maintain registry of all services and their SLAs
Regular review and update of service documentation

mistakes.mistake: Third-party services without security verification or monitoring
mistakes.description: Using cloud or third-party network services without verifying security capabilities or monitoring compliance
root_cause: Lack of awareness of third-party risk
Assumption that reputable providers are secure
Cost and time constraints on evaluation
Lack of resources for ongoing monitoring
mistakes.impact: Third-party breaches affecting organisation, customer data exposure, regulatory violation, loss of control
prevention: Include security requirements in service selection process
Include security requirements in service agreements
Conduct regular monitoring of third-party compliance

mistakes.mistake: No monitoring or verification of service level compliance
mistakes.description: SLAs established but not monitored or verified allowing service degradation without detection
root_cause: Lack of resources for ongoing monitoring
Assumption that services will maintain quality
mistakes.impact: Service outages undetected, performance degradation affecting operations, SLA breaches unknown, customer impact
prevention: Implement automated monitoring of service metrics
Configure alerts for SLA threshold violations
Establish regular reporting of service compliance
Conduct monthly reviews of service levels
Document any SLA breaches and corrective actions

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 8.21 audit

audit_areas.description: Verify network services are identified and documented
checks: Inventory of all network services exists
Service documentation includes purpose and criticality
Service provider documented for third-party services

audit_areas.description: Verify security mechanisms and requirements defined
checks: Security requirements documented for each service

audit_areas.description: Verify SLAs established with security and performance metrics
checks: SLA includes availability and performance targets

audit_areas.description: Verify access policies and procedures documented
Verify service access and activities are monitored and logged
Verify SLA compliance is monitored and reported
Verify third-party services meet security requirements
Verify critical network services secured appropriately

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: For gambling operators, network service security is critical for maintaining game availability, protecting customer transactions and ensuring compliance. UKGC expects documented service levels, security requirements and monitoring of critical network services including internal and third-party services.
specific_requirements: Network service availability targets aligned with business requirements and communicated to UKGC
Game delivery network services with documented SLAs for availability and performance
Payment processor network connections secured with encryption and monitoring
Customer account access network services with security controls and availability requirements
Regulatory reporting network services with reliability and audit trail requirements
Backup and recovery network services with documented recovery time objectives
Third-party service agreements including security requirements and audit rights
Third-party attestations (SOC 2 Type II, ISO 27001) reviewed and maintained
Regular monitoring and reporting of network service SLA compliance
Incident procedures for network service failures affecting customer operations
ukgc_application.compliance_requirement: Gambling operators must document security requirements and service levels for all network services, implement security mechanisms and monitoring, and demonstrate compliance through regular monitoring and reporting

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Ensure network services meet security requirements and agreed service levels through documented requirements, implementation, monitoring and verification
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: Important - network service failures can directly impact customer operations and regulatory compliance; security controls must be verified working
key_principles: All network services identified and documented
Security requirements defined for each service
Service levels established with clear metrics
Logging and monitoring of service access
Regular SLA compliance monitoring and reporting
Regular testing and verification of security

gambling_operator_specific_guidance.game_delivery_network_services: Network services delivering games to customers must have documented availability targets and performance SLAs. Service level agreements should specify uptime requirements (typically 99.5% or higher) and response time targets. Game delivery network services must be monitored continuously for availability and performance.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.payment_processing_network_services: Payment processor connections must be secured with encryption and have documented SLAs for availability and security incident response. Service agreements with payment processors should include security requirements and audit rights. Third-party attestations from payment processors should be reviewed regularly.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.customer_account_network_services: Network services for customer account access must have availability and performance SLAs. Authentication and authorization controls must be enforced. Access should be monitored for fraud indicators.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.regulatory_reporting_network_services: Network services used for regulatory reporting must have reliability targets and audit trail requirements. Backup connectivity may be required for critical reporting. Service failures must be escalated immediately.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.disaster_recovery_and_backup: Backup and recovery network services must have documented recovery time objectives (RTO) and recovery point objectives (RPO). Regular testing of backup and recovery services must be demonstrated. Third-party disaster recovery services should be verified through testing.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.audit_readiness: To be audit-ready: provide inventory of all network services; provide documented SLAs for each service; provide evidence of SLA compliance monitoring; provide third-party attestations; provide logs of service access and activities; demonstrate monitoring and alerting; provide evidence of regular testing and SLA reviews.
